meanings.definition: A framework of metal bars used as a cover or screen
meanings.sent1: The grilles on the window kept the bugs out.
meanings.sent2: The car's front grille added a stylish touch to its design.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb through the grille but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a tangled mess of grilles, blocking clarity.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the intricate grille, casting beautiful patterns on the floor.

meanings.definition: A decorative arrangement of parallel bars
meanings.sent1: The elegant grille on the gate matched the Victorian style of the house.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a melody on the grille of the xylophone.
meanings.sent3: The grille on the cake was made of chocolate, tempting everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her voice flowed smoothly through the grille of the microphone, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The grille on the fence created a sense of privacy while still allowing a view of the garden.

meanings.sent1: He decided to grille the windows for added security.
meanings.sent2: She carefully grilled the vegetables on the barbecue grille.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully asked if he should grille the steak for one more minute.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to grille her heart, leaving her feeling exposed.
meanings.sent5: The artist planned to grille the sculpture with intricate patterns to enhance its beauty.
